EVTDESC_chaos_dwarf_buy_stuff;You have decided to buy armaments from the Chaos Dwarfs of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. [From.GetTitledFirstName] receives you at the gates of [From.Capital.GetName]: Welcome to Mighty [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName], [Root.Culture.GetName]! Which grand creation of the Dawi Zharr do you wish to purchase?
I wish to buy Chaos weapons and armours for my warriors!
A regiment of mighty Doomcannons!
I will buy nothing from you squat weaklings!

[From.GetTitledFirstName], a [From.Culture.GetName] from [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] has come to [Root.Capital.GetName] seeking to purchase Chaos armours and weapons from our factories to arm [Root.GetHerHis] warriors.

[From.GetTitledFirstName], a [From.Culture.GetName] from [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] has come to [Root.Capital.GetName] seeking to purchase a regiment of mighty Doomcanon infernal engines from our factories.
Very well! Get those armaments ready!
Very well! Get those Doomcannons ready!
No! I won't sell anything to a filthy [From.Culture.GetName]!

Now that you've decided what to purchase from [From.Capital.GetName]'s factories, you have to pay the price for it. The Chaos Dwarfs accept payments in gold or slaves. If you wish to pay in slaves, you'll need to either give them slaves from your own pits or some inhabitants of your capital province.
I will pay in gold!
I will pay in slaves from my own pits!
That's incredibly expensive. Maybe next time.
The people of [Root.Capital.GetName] shall be my payment!
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has decided to pay in gold. While it isn't a payment as good as slaves would have been, it's still good enough.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has decided to pay you in slaves from [From.GetHerHis] pits. The slaves appear to be weary, having been taken from many lands and races, but are still in good condition to work in our factories or serve in our hosts.

Amusingly enough, [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] has decided to chain [From.GetHerHis] own people in [From.Capital.GetName] and send them to you as slaves! The [From.Culture.GetName] slaves appear to be in a decent condition, enough to work in our factories or serve in our hosts!
It is enough indeed.
A thousand slaves for our toil!
A thousand slaves for our toil!

Finally, the detachment of Doomcannons that you brought from [From.GetTitledFirstName] has arrived at [Root.Capital.GetName]! Mighty infernal engines of terrible destructive power, the Doomcannons are accompanied by a small regiment of Chaos Dwarf Hellforge Guards, to ensure that the demons trapped inside the engines don't turn them against their masters.

The Chaos weapons and armour you brought from [From.GetTitledFirstName] have finally arrived at [Root.Capital.GetName]! Your warriors are starting to arm themselves with these powerful items... their strength will surely be incremented a thousandfold!.
Mighty devices indeed!
We will be unstoppable!
New, fresh slaves have arrived at [Root.Capital.GetName]. Where shall we send them to work?
A regiment of Doomcannons arrives in [Root.Capital.GetName]
Tame a Great Taurus
I will soar on wings of fire and smoke!
Bargain with a Lammasu
A cunning beast, the Lammasu may only be mounted by those chosen by Hashut!

Most of the Great Tauruses in the plains of Zharrduk come from the breeding pens under the temple of Hashut in Zharr-Naggrund. While most of the beasts there are fully grown, it takes time for the Chaos Dwarf Sorcerers to attune the beast's binding enchantments to a new rider. These rituals will be completed in 5 years.

Outside of the plains of Zharrduk, the Great Tauruses can only be found in their natural habitats, inside the calderas of active volcanoes. You have managed to convince one of the Bull Centaurs guarding [From.Capital.GetName]'s temple to snatch a young calf from one of the nearby volcanoes. The beast will be fully grown and magically bound in 5 years.
Excellent

Finally, the Great Taurus is tamed, the magical beast's binding enchantments fully attuned so that it obeys your will completely. The Great Tauruses are considered by the Chaos Dwarfs to be the living images of Hashut, great, winged bulls surrounded by a wreathing aura of infernal flame.
On wings of fire and smoke I soar!

Only the Sorcerer-Prophets of Hashut have the magical prowess to master a Lammasu as their mount. But these beasts cannot be binded by magic alone, like the Great Tauruses. Lammasus are cunning, intelligent beasts, and must as well be bargained within order to be completely mastered, for not even the Dawi Zharr would dare mount a Lammasu without pacting with it before. The process to find, convince and master a Lammasu will take 5 years.
Excellent

Finally, the Lammasu has been brought down to your service, through equal parts of deceit and magical skill. The Lammasus are beasts of insidious cunning, resembling Great Tauruses in it's bovine body, leathery wings and back quarters, but with clawed forelimbs and an eerie bearded, and horned face, resembling a Chaos Dwarf in many ways.
Hashut favours me!
Worshippers of Chaos Undivided, Khorne, Nurgle, Tzeentch and Slaanesh can use this only against these same religions. Worshippers of Hashut may only subjugate worshippers of Hashut.
Slaves taken by Chaos Dwarfs
A host of Chaos Dwarfs has laid waste to this province and taken most of its population as slaves.
Devastated by Chaos Dwarfs
A host of Chaos Dwarfs has laid waste to this province.
Some courtiers residing in [From.GetName] will be taken as slaves
Take them as slaves, and burn this land!

The province of [From.GetName] has been raided and burned to the ground by our great hosts. Most of your overseers are on their way to [Root.Capital.GetName], herding the slaves you previously captured in another assault, but your personal entourage can still herd a small quantity of them...
Sell armaments to [Root.GetTitledFirstName]

The Chaos Dwarfs are known to trade the armaments they produce on their factories with the Chaos worshippers of the Northern Wastes and the Greenskins, in exchange for gold or slaves.\n [Root.GetTitledFirstName] will get the choice to buy either weapons and armours for your warriors, or a contingent of Doomcannons from us.
Some courtiers residing in [From.GetName] will be sacrificed to Hashut.
Hasn't made Sacrifices

This character has committed sacrilege against the Father of Darkness by forgoing to feed any sacrifices to the furnaces of Hashut for too long. An offering must be made to the Bullfather soon, or this character will face the disdain of its peers.
Hashut's Scorn
This character has earned the ire of Hashut by providing an unworthy sacrifice.

For too long have the furnaces at [Root.Capital.GetName] remained silent and devoid of any kind of offering. You have gone 4 years without a proper sacrifice to Hashut. The Father of Darkness does not look kindly upon those who fail to pay Him tribute...
I'm sure the Bullfather doesn't mind...
Celebrate a Grand Sacrifice
Raise the icon. Load the furnaces. The Father of Darkness will have His spoils today, that we may be blessed tomorrow...

The acolytes of Hashut have prepared the furnaces at the top of [Root.Capital.GetName]'s ziggurat for your grand sacrifice ceremony by chanting the sacred dirges. Now is the time, to offer the souls of slaves and wretches to the Bullfather, so that our Lord Hashut may feast on them.\n\nThe temple's Bull Centaurs look to you with anticipation, ready to retrieve the next sacrifice at your command...
Herd in slaves from the factories!
Bring the wretches that form our slave levies!
Our prisoners shall have the honour to become sacrifice!
I've changed my mind! Hashut doesn't deserve any gifts!

Your watch gleefully as the Bull Centaurs drag [From.GetTitledFirstName] up the stairs of the ziggurat, towards the great, brazen statue of Hashut, a pool of molten metal beneath it acts as it's furnace. As the Bull Centaur places [From.GetHerHim] close to the furnace, you hear the mumblings of a prayer to [From.Religion.GetHighGodName].\n\n[From.GetFirstName] tries to keep a stoic composure... but it soon fades into agony as [From.GetSheHe] is submerged into the molten metal...

As the last of the sacrifice's laments echo through the chamber... you feel that your body is now strong as a Bull Centaur's and your mind is quick as a Daemon's... certainly, you have been blessed by the Bullfather!

As the last of the sacrifice's laments echo through the chamber... you don't notice any changes, at first, but when you step out of the Zigurrat's ceremonal changer you notice that your whole land has been covered in a thick, red smoke which seems to be unnaturally empowering your forges and slaves, certainly [Root.Capital.GetName] has been blessed by the Bullfather!

As the last of the sacrifice's laments echo through the chamber... you don't see any changes, at first, but when you step out of the Zigurrat's ceremonal changer you notice that a small regiment of Bull Centaurs is waiting at it's feet, willing to serve you! Clearly, this is Father Hashut's providence gracing us!

As the last of the sacrifice's laments echo through the chamber... you notice a cloud of red smoke forming in front of you, in a wink, it quickly files towards you and forces itself down your throat, making you pass out... when you awake, you're informed by the temple's Acolytes that you must have somehow earned Hashut's wrath, and indeed, you feel much weaker...
Curses!

Your watch gleefully as the Bull Centaurs herd in masses of slaves up the stairs of the ziggurat, towards the great, brazen statue of Hashut, a pool of molten metal beneath it acts as it's furnace. As the Bull Centaur places them close to the furnace, you hear multiple mumbles and whimpers coming from the wretches.\n\nThey're pushed one by one into the pool of molten metal, their anguished laments forming a wonderful choir...
Mighty Hashut! Accept the slave blood and slave flesh we offer thee!
Note that Chaos Dwarfs or Nehekharan Tomb Kings aren't a valid prisoner sacrifice!
The slave population in [Root.Capital.GetName]'s factories has recently declined due to chocking smoke, factory accidents, famine and general mismanagement
Hashut's cock! Well, we'll have to get more slaves...
The population in [Root.Capital.GetName]'s slave barracks has recently declined due to chocking smoke, incompetent hobgoblin overseers, famine and general mismanagement
Hashut's cock! Well, we'll have to get more slaves...
The Bullfather is pleased with your offering. As your sacrifice dissolves into the molten metal pit, you hear a booming voice coming from the brazen idol's head...offering you gifts
Grant me some of your fiery K'daai servants, to sear my enemies!
Mighty Hashut, bless me with your strength!
Great Hashut, touch my lands with your fire!
Bullfather, grant me greater dominion over the Winds!
The Bullfather must be pleased with you, for after your sacrifice dissolves into the molten pit, a daemonic creature of fire and steel surges from it, pledging itself to your service
Bend to my will, daemon!
As your sacrifice sinks into the molten metal, you hear a bellowing in the outside. Hashut has sent you a Great Taurus, one of his most favoured creatures!
I will soar on wings of fire!
The Bullfather is pleased. You watch as the molten metal takes into different shapes and forms... showing images of yourself surrounded by power and riches!
It will all be mine!
As the sacrifice sinks into the molten pit you hear the booming voice of Hashut in your head, praising you... His greatest son!
All will bow before me!
After the sacrifice sinks into the molten metal pit, you receive visions of yourself... a crown of fire is on your brows, burning... burning, until naught but ash remains...
Why? What is the meaning of this?!
As the sacrifice sinks into the molten pit you get closer to it, in order to receive your gift... when suddenly a gush of molten metal sprays you in the face
AAAAGH!!
At last the sacrifice dissolves into the molten pit of metal... and the ritual room is filled with a most dire silence. It seems that the Bullfather has ignored your offering!
Hashut's balls!

Praise Mighty Hashut! After all the sacrifices and absolute servitude, the Bullfather has finally granted you His greatest of gifts: dominion over the Winds of Magic! Soon the whole world will be under your yoke, for now, you're one of the great, magnificent masters of the Dawi Zharr, a Sorcerer-Prophet!
ALL FOR HASHUT!
K'daai
Hashuti K'daai

The K'daai Zharr - Scions of Fire - are Hashut's servants. Forged from the raging blood and metal of the Bullfather's sacrifice pits, the K'daai are half-daemon and half-raging fire, an elemental force of destruction few mortals can hope to survive.
Daemon of Hashut
Though Hashut has fewer daemons aligned to him than the greater Chaos gods, they're still powerful entities, made to enslave and destroy all those who oppose him.
The K'daai slowly takes form before you, a creature of magma and iron, half-daemon and half-raging fire. The circle holds and the daemon is yours to command.
I am your Master now.
Your ritual for [From.GetFirstName] was a success. You've managed to bind a searing K'daai to [From.GetHerHim].
Excellent.
Bull Centaurs
Infernal Guard
Infernal Guard with Fireglaives
Earthshaker Cannons
Sacrificed family member
Not already casting spells
Cast magic on the battlefield
You may choose and cast a damaging spell from any of your Lores you have learned.
I can't cast any more spells of this lore until 30 days have passed.
Settle the Tribes
I can choose to settle the people of my tribe into these foreign lands.
Serve the Dark Gods
Oh infinite masters, let me serve you until the end of time!
There are non-tribal provinces with empty holdings.
Members from your tribe will occupy feudal provinces.
Recruit a Soldier
Persuade a young warrior to fight for your cause.
Win a War
[This.GetTitledFirstName] would like to win a war.
§Y[This.GetTitledFirstName]§! wins a war.
Khypris

Khypris (formerly the Capital of the vast Khyprian Empire) is one of the original Kingdoms of the Borderlands, once reaching to the tip of the Black Mountains and comprising of the three provinces of the Northlands, the Heartland and the Westland's. While the age of the khyprote empire is long gone, the city still remains a wondrous site on the region, and heavily controls trade in the region.
Argalis

The City-State of Argalis has had a long and chequered history, first built by the High Elves and named Tor Ancor around -3419. It then fell during the war of vengeance in -1974 when a Dwarf army marched on it following the death of Prince Snorri Halfhand (in a duel with Caledor the 2nd). Only a small colony, the Elves abandoned Tor Ancor to its fate and it was razed to the ground soon after by the vengeful Dwarves. The city lay in ruins until human tribesmen willingly built on the ruins of the former Elf colony in -1125  seeking to make their mark as the dominant tribe in the region. Unfortunately this tribe attracted the attention of a Vampire  whose bloodline would later be traced to the Von Carstein's.
Akendorf

Akendorf has an electoral-monarchy system in which leaders are voted into power, Akendorf's nobles run an electoral monarchy system. They have economy centred on timber, woodcarvings, they hunt wild boars in the forests which is an eagerly sought after commodity for the furs and meat.
Arnalos

Arnalos straddles along the river Limnalia, having been founded as a High Elven colony many centuries ago, but abandon and then resettled by Humans, only to have the Vampire counts take control of the region for some time. The city has recovered to an extent, and exerts control over some of the many trade routes to and from the Vaults.
Aldium
Aldium is a popular destination for Dogs-of-War and would-be mercenaries, but recent evidence suggests that it used to be an old Dwarf hold, why it was forgotten is unknown.
Domatburg

The closest human settlement to Karak Thorinkin and the only major one actually found within the mountain ranges themselves. The Thorinkin maintain a fortress (Khazad Thufill) near to Domatburg helping guard passes through the mountains and the trade road that links the town and the hold together. Relations between the two peoples are very strong with the Thorinkin actually constructing Domatburg's defences and providing support for the humans against Grobbi that infest the area. The relationship was strong enough that an area between Domatburg and Khazad Thufill was chosen by King Druegar Stromnisson as the site for the Holds new Brewery.
Fatandira

Fatandira is a member of the Northern Confederacy City-States  Fatanbad is their sister City State. Due to it's close proximity to Greenskins and the Stygian woods, the population and thus power of the city has declined recently.
Myrmidens

Myrmidens was founded by settlers from Luccinni in Tilea and named in honour of the goddess Myrmidia, it is one of the largest realms of the Borderlands and a traditional naval enemy of Achaes, and keeps the Sartosian pirates and Greenskin raiders away from Tilea.
Ruins of Slayer Keep

Karak Kadrin, otherwise known as Slayer Keep, is a mighty Dwarf hold that has guarded the one of the few major passes through World's Edge Mountains, the peak pass. For countless centuries this hold has guarded the lands of Kislev and the Empire to west against greenskin threats and worse. The hold is home to the Shrine of Grimnir and is a sacred place for all would-be Slayers. The hold also has a long history of Slayer Kings who have passed down their slayer oath through generations.
Ruins of Everpeak

Everpeak, Karaz-a-Karak in the language of the Dwarfs, is the ancient capital of the Dwarf empire, the Pinnacle of Mountains, the Most Enduring. It is the oldest and most glorious holds of the mountain folk and inside its halls is the greatest concentration of wealth in the world. Visitors have been awestruck at the magnificent beauty of the place. The most important hold politically and religiously in Dwarf culture, Karaz-a-Karak boasts of the mightiest army, greatest runesmiths and largest population out of all the Dwarf realms. It is from here that the High Kings rule and where the sacred Great Book of Grudges and the Book of Remembering are kept. It has endured countless ages against all manner of foes but it has never fallen and will endure until the end of time.
Ruins of Zhufbar

Zhufbar, known as the Torrent-Gate in Khazalid, is a dwarf hold built nestled in a deep chasm under the lake called Black Water. A huge waterfall that falls high above the city provides the necessary power for the numerous Dwarf machines that have been constructed here. The city is the principle shrine for the Engineers Guild and is a center of every kind of industry. It was here that the famed Gromril metal, which was mined from nearby Karak Varn, was smelted and forged into many famous Dwarfen artefacts.
Ruins of  Barak Varr

Barak Varr is a unique Dwarf hold in that it is the only Dwarf seaport in the world and houses the whole Dwarf fleet. Located at the easternmost point of the Black Gulf, the hold is built in a vast water filled cavern, carved into a cliffside which provides a natural defence for the harbour. The mighty Ironclad ships of the Dwarfs as well as numerous merchant vessels from all over the world can be found here as well, sailing in and out of the vast cavern. This hold is among the most friendly to non-Dwarfs and in turn has great revenue from trade.
Ruins of Iron Peak
Ruins of Horn Hold
Ruins of Copper Mountain
Ruins of Karak Norn
Follower of Tchar

This character worships Tchar, also known as the Raven God or the Windlord, the Norscan God of magic, secrets and change. His totem animal is the Raven.\nThis trait will make you tolerant to the worshippers of the Dark Gods..
Follower of Kjörn

This character worships Kjörn, also known as Yngve or Khorghar, the Norscan God of war and wrath and the Lord of Battle. His totem animal is the Bull.\nThis trait will make you tolerant to the worshippers of the Dark Gods.
Follower of Nierg

This character worships Nierg, also known as Onogal or the Worm God, the Norscan God of decay and entropy, and Father of the 10 plagues. His totem animal is the Toad.\nThis trait will make you tolerant to the worshippers of the Dark Gods.
Follower of Loesh

This character worships Loesh, also known as Frøyia or Shornaal, the Norscan Goddess of desire and pleasure and the Deciever. Her totem animal is the Serpent.\nThis trait will make you tolerant to the worshippers of the Dark Gods.
Follower of Olric

This character worships Olric, also known as Ukko or the Snow King, the Norscan God of battle, winter, and wolves and High King of the pantheon. His totem animal is the Wolf.\nThis trait will make you tolerant to the worshippers of the Old World Gods.
Follower of Órsen

This character worships Órsen, also known as Otso or the Great Bear, the Norscan God of the hunt and bravery and Father of Bears. His totem animal is the Bear.\nThis trait will make you tolerant to the worshippers of the Old World Gods.
The Theogonacy
Successor
Lector
My best candidate
Of all the Sigmarite priests in my realm, this one is the likeliest to enter the Theogonacy
Expected next Lector
This priest is to become a Lector of the Theogonacy, once a position becomes available
Religious Head Electors
§YReligious Head Suitability: $SCORE$§!
The [Root.Religion.GetName] Faith Triumphant

In 1359 IC, Countess Ottilia of Talabecland refused to recognize the elected Emperor, the count of Stirland, on the grounds that the election had been a sham, rigged by the Cult of Sigmar. She crowned herself Empress with the support of the cult of Ulric, declaring Sigmar a false god. This action completely split apart the already fractured Imperial faiths, with each of the large cults (Sigmar, Ulric and Taal) supporting a different Imperial claimant. [Root.GetTitledFirstName] has finally imposed the supremacy of the [Root.Religion.GetName]s as the Imperial state cult, and declared all other imperial faiths as heresies.
The [From.Religion.GetName] Faith Triumphant

In 1359 IC, Countess Ottilia of Talabecland refused to recognize the elected Emperor, the count of Stirland, on the grounds that the election had been a sham, rigged by the Cult of Sigmar. She crowned herself Empress with the support of the cult of Ulric, declaring Sigmar a false god. This action completely split apart the already fractured Imperial faiths, with each of the large cults (Sigmar, Ulric and Taal) supporting a different Imperial claimant. [Root.GetTitledFirstName] has finally imposed the supremacy of the [Root.Religion.GetName]s as the Imperial state cult, and declared all other imperial faiths as heresies.
Praise [From.Religion.GetHighGodName]!
Unify the Imperial faiths
Unify Imperial religion under the [Root.Religion.GetName] banner!
Unified Imperial Faiths
Hire an Engineer

Hiring one of the Engineers from the renowned Imperial Engineers School is not cheap, but having one of these inventors in our court will ensure the production of ingenious warmachines, like the mighty Steam Tanks
The Engineer we hired from the Imperial Engineers School has arrived, he will sure be a great asset to our court.
Good
Put Engineer to Work
Have your Engineer to start working on building one of the School's famed war machines.
Khalida

As the embodiment of the Asp Goddess in full fury,a wave of pure terror rolls over all those who would dare to look upon her. With divine energy flowing through her limbs,Queen Khalida brings war and death to any who threaten her realm and the greater lands of Nehekhara.[1b] Venom runs in Khalida's veins,and she moves with the speed of a striking asp. Only when all her foes lie dead at her feet does she lead her legions back to Lybaras and sit upon her throne as Queen once more. However,though Khalida sleeps,her soul is troubled. Deep within the High Queen burns a loathing for those tainted by Nagash's vile sorcery,and only when she finally kills her treacherous cousin and her vile race,will she finally know true peace.

Your engineer will begin preparations towards starting his project. You can choose to either build 50 mighty great cannons or one of the famed steam tanks. Note that some of the local workforce and treasury in your capital will be directed towards the Engineer's project.
The cannons would be a fine addition to my army!
Let's see the famed Steam Tank!
On a second thought...
Your engineer reports that your batch of 50 great cannons is complete. These artillery pieces are of the finest craft, worthy of the Imperial Engineers School!
Your engineer reports that the mighty Steam tank is complete. This wonderful steam-driven invention will crush all opposition!
What a wonderful machine!
Engineer Working on Artillery
Engineer Working on Steam Tank
Buccaneer
This man has earned his reputation as a dreaded pirate and corsair.
[Root.GetFirstName]'s Plunder Fleet
Create Plunder Fleet

You can finance [Root.GetFirstName], one of blaggards in your court and grant [Root.GetHerHim] command of a fleet to plunder in your name. While not vassalized, [Root.GetSheHe] will plunder nearby lands and send the booty back to you, this is, assuming [Root.GetSheHe] likes you well enough...

The plundering and looting undertaken by your fleets has earned you a reputation as a fearsome pirate. All along the seas of the world, mothers tucking their children in for the night warn that unless they behave, the terrible Captain [Root.GetFirstName], scourge of the seven seas, will come ashore with [Root.GetHerHis] dire seadogs and take them away.
column3: Les pillages commis en votre nom vous ont valu une réputation de redoutable razzieur fer-né. Tout le long des côtes de Westeros, les mères bordent leurs enfants le soir en leur disant que s'ils ne sont pas sages, le terrible [Root.GetFirstName], le fléau des mers, débarquera avec ses guerriers morts-vivants pour les manger.
column4: Das Brandschatzen und Plündern in Eurem Namen hat Euch den Ruf eines furchtlosen Wikinger-Räubers eingebracht. An allen Küsten Europas bringen Mütter ihre Kinder abends zu Bett und flüstern Warnungen, dass der Schrecken [Root.GetFirstName], die Geißel der Meere, mit seinen untoten Kriegern kommen und sie fressen wird, wenn sie sich nicht benehmen.
column6: El pillaje y el saqueo llevado a cabo en tu nombre te ha dado una reputación de temible asaltante Vikingo. A lo largo de las costas de Europa, las madres advierten a sus hijos cuando llega la noche que si no se comportan, el terrible [Root.GetFirstName], castigo de los mares, llegará a tierra con sus guerreros muertos vivientes y se los comerán.

column2: Arrr, mateys!

You were sailing the seas around [Root.Location.GetName], a location known to be targetted by pirates, when a small fleet of ships was spotted sailing for you. The crew quickly realise that is indeed a pirate fleet, but is too late. Your ship is captured, along with all of its crew, and you the biggest prize.
column3: Vous naviguiez à proximité de [Root.Location.GetName], un endroit connu pour être infesté de pirates, lorsque vous avez aperçu une petite flotte de bateaux. L'équipe a très vite réalisé qu'il s'agissait de pirates, mais il était trop tard. Votre navire a été capturé, tout comme son équipage... et vousè-même. Vous êtes sûrement la prise qui a le plus de valeur.

column2: I hope this [From.GetTitle] accepts a ransom

A small flotilla commanded by one of your lesser captains was prowling the seas near [From.Location.GetName] when they came upon a lightly defended ship. The captain reports that the ship and crew were captured without much trouble, and that one particularly noble passenger was found. [From.GetSheHeCap] identifies [From.GetHerHim]self [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName].
column3: Une petite flotille commandée par l'un de vos capitaines rôdait sur les mers près de [From.Location.GetName] lorsqu'elle a rencontré un navire légèrement défendu. Le capitaine dit que le navire et l'équipage ont été capturés sans grandes difficultés et qu'un passage noble s'y trouvait. [From.GetSheHeCap] dit être [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName].

column2: Good work, a most valuable prisoner
column3: Bien joué, une prise de valeur.

column2: We have had reports that a great misfortune has befallen to your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName]. [From.GetSheHeCap] had been sailing the seas near [From.Location.GetName] when they were attacked by a flotilla of pirates! [From.GetTitledFirstName] and the crew are now reportedly in the captivity of [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName].
column3: Nous avons reçu de mauvaises nouvelles concernant votre [GetFromRelation] [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName]. [From.GetSheHeCap] naviguait près de [From.Location.GetName] lorsque son navire a été attaqué par une flotille pirate ! [From.GetTitledFirstName] et son équipage sont aux mains de [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName].

column2: This [FromFrom.Culture.GetName] menace must be stopped
The Ruinous Powers are generous to those who sacrifice in their name. Which of the Four Gods shall receive your offering?
Khorne, the Lord of Skulls!
Nurgle, the Plaguefather!
Tzeentch, the Architect of Fate!
Slaanesh, the Prince of Pleasure!
Worship Khorne
The Lord of Skulls has clearly shown his favour towards you. Why keep worshipping the other weaklings?
Worship Nurgle
Papa Nurgle has clearly shown his love towards you. Why keep worshipping the other gods?
Worship Tzeentch
Clearly, the Architect of Fate has a special destiny in store for you. Why keep worshipping the lesser gods?
Worship Slaanesh
The Prince of Pleasure has shown... interest in your talents. Why not worship her beauty above all the other gods?
This act will greatly please the Chaos God you'll dedicate to, but the other 3 will consider it a great offense.
The Everchosen

The End is nigh! News have reached you that a new Everchosen - the annnoined champion of the Ruinous Powers - has risen in the Chaos Wastes. Whether this new Everchosen will bring forth the End Times or fall after the stalwart defenders of the World remains to be seen...
[Root.Religion.GetHighGodName], protect us!
FOR CHAOS!
More spiky gitz fer stomping!
Bah, a puppet of the Dark Gods!
Yes-yes, it is time-hour for the Great Ascendancy!
The Everchosen Falls!

Everchosen [Root.GetFirstName] has fallen! Whether through sword or intrigue the annoined champion of the Dark Gods is dead! The defenders of Order can rest easy... for now. Chaos has no beggining, and so, it has no end\n\n In time, another Everchosen will ride forth from the Chaos Wastes and yet again bring ruin in the name of the Dark Gods.
Victory, Praise the gods!
Weakling! Failure!
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName]! I offer you this chance to to fulfill your destiny and join the Hosts of Chaos Undivided. Refuse and I will bring you ruin.
Come and get me, coward!
I willingly surrender before the Everchosen.
[From.GetBestName], has refused [From.GetHerHis] destiny to server the Ruinous Powers. [From.GetHerHis] suffering will be endless.
I BRING RUIN!
[From.GetBestName], has accepted [From.GetHerHis] destiny and has pledged [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] to the Hosts of Chaos Undivided.
As it should be.
Everchosen

The Everchosen, also known as the Lord of the End Times, is a mortal champion behind whom all the Chaos Gods unite. War and death, famine and plague follow this great warrior wherever they tread, and nature itself abhors their presence.
Armour of Morkar

The Armour of Morkar belonged to Morkar, the first Everchosen. It makes the wearer invulnerable to all but the most powerful of attacks. It is one of the Six Treasures of Chaos, the Everchosen's regalia.
Crown of Domination

Forged before the dawn of man, the Crown of Domination once held the Eye of Sheerian, but had been lost to history. It strikes terror into the bearer's foes and gives strength to his allies. It is one of the Six Treasures of Chaos, the Everchosen's regalia.
Eye of Sheerian

The Eye of Sheerian is named after the Tzeentchian Sorcerer who discovered it. Although on its own it grants the bearer prophetic powers, when placed in the Crown of Domination its prophetic powers can be used to their true ability to allow the bearer to predict and avoid the attacks of the enemy. It is one of the Six Treasures of Chaos, the Everchosen's regalia.
Slayer of Kings

The Slayer of Kings was the sacred blade of Vangel, the second Everchosen. He bound the Greater Daemon U'zuhl into the blade, and the millennia of imprisonment have sent it insane with rage and fury. It is one of the Six Treasures of Chaos, the Everchosen's regalia.
Dorghar, Steed of the Apocalypse

Alternatively known as Ghurshy'ish'phak or Yrontalie, this daemonic steed was stolen from the menagerie of the Daemon Prince Agrammon in the Realm of Chaos. He is one of the Six Treasures of Chaos, the Everchosen's regalia.
the Brazen
the Eviscerator
the Betrayer
the Reviled
the Neverborn
the Soulless
the Golden
the Faithless
the Eternal
the Thousand-Eyed
the Warpbound
the Wyrd
the Anointed
The Engineers Guild

The Engineers Guild is one of the most important, powerful and secretive of all the Craftsmen Guilds of the Dwarfs, whose purpose is in providing the Everlasting Realm with the latest in a long-line of technological advancements and magnificent machinery. This illustrious institution is located within the great workshops of Zhufbar.
column3: Ceux qui servent le Grand Adversaire se cachent au milieu de nous, consacrant leurs dépravations et perfidies à leur Seigneur Satan. Chaque transgression est un hymne, chaque assassinat un rugissement de défi contre la parole [Root.GetHighGodDuDelaDes]. Lucifer récompense généreusement de tels sombres sacrements  les sorciers sont dits dotés d'une durée de vie anormale et de pouvoirs démoniaques.
column4: Die Jünger des Antichrist verstecken sich in unserer Mitte und huldigen in perfider Verderbtheit Satan, ihrem Herrn. Jede Sünde ist ihnen Hymnus, jeder Mord ein Aufschrei gegen das Wort von [Root.Religion.GetHighGodNameCap]. Luzifer belohnt die Priester seiner dunklen Sakramente fürstlich: So heißt es, dass er Hexen ein unnatürlich langes Leben schenkt und ihnen alle möglichen dämonischen Kräfte verleiht.
column6: Aquellos que sirven al Gran Adversario se ocultan entre nosotros, dedicando sus depravaciones y perfidias a su señor, Satanás. Cada transgresión es un himno cada asesinato es un rugido de desafío contra la palabra de [Root.Religion.GetHighGodNameCap]. Lucifer recompensa esos sacramentos oscuros generosamente: se dice que las brujas están dotadas de una vida antinatural y de toda clase de poderes demoníacos.

Engineer

column2: The Engineers Guild

Greetings [Root.GetTitledFirstName]!
After consulting it with the guild's longbeards, we have decided to accept your application into the Engineers Guild.
By the grace of Morgrim, Patron of Engineers and son of Grimnir.
Signed, [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
column3:
Salutations, [Root.GetTitledFirstName] !
Nous sommes ravis d'apprendre que vous avez fait votre premier pas vers l'illumination. Les secrets du Corpus peuvent vous paraître obscurs, mais avec le temps vous pourrez les comprendre aussi bien que moi.

Gardez à l'esprit ce que vous voulez savoir, et [Root.GetHermesThriceBlessed], vous l'enseignera.
Signé, [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
column4:
Seid gegrüßt, [Root.GetTitledFirstName]!
Wir sind davon entzückt, zu erfahren, dass Ihr Euren ersten Schritt auf dem Weg zur Erleuchtung getan habt, [Root.GetTitle]. Die Geheimnisse des Corpus mögen Euch zwar jetzt noch verborgen sein, doch mit der Zeit werdet Ihr sie so wie ich selbst zu verstehen beginnen.

Denkt immer an das Wissen, das Euch verheißen ist, dann wird [Root.GetHermesThriceBlessed] es Euch auch lehren.
Gezeichnet

[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
column6:
Saludos, [Root.GetTitledFirstName]:
Nos complace saber que has dado tu primer paso hacia la iluminación, [Root.GetTitle]. Los secretos del Corpus pueden parecerte oscuros ahora, pero con el tiempo lograrás comprenderlos tan bien como yo.

Guarda en tu mente lo que quieres aprender, que [Root.GetHermesThriceBlessed] te enseñará.
Firmado: [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]

column2: Excellent!
Donate to the Engineers Guild
Support the Engineers Guild through a donation. This will surely get you in good fraces with the Guild's longbeards.
Support the Engineers Guild through a donation. This will surely get you in good fraces with the Guild's longbeards.
Donated a Dwarf Guild
Hire a Dwarf Engineer
Send for a trained engineer from the Guilds of Zhufbar to join you in your hold.
Send for a trained engineer from the Guilds of Zhufbar to join you in your hold.
Hired a Dwarf Engineer
Request Thunderers
As a member of the Engineers Guild, you're able to send a request to the guild's longbeards for a regiment of trained Thunderers, armed with the finest in Dwarf gunsmithing.
As a member of the Engineers Guild, you're able to send a request to the guild's longbeards for a regiment of trained Thunderers, armed with the finest in Dwarf gunsmithing.
A regiment of 100 gunners will arrive at your capital hold of [Root.Capital.GetName].
Request Cannons
As a member of the Engineers Guild, you're able to send a request to the guild's longbeards for some of the finest Dwarf cannons manned by an experienced engineer crew.
As a member of the Engineers Guild, you're able to send a request to the guild's longbeards for some of the finest Dwarf cannons manned by an experienced engineer crew.
A regiment of 50 cannons will arrive at your capital hold of [Root.Capital.GetName].
Request Gyrocopters
As a member of the Engineers Guild, you're able to send a request to the guild's longbeards for a wing of Gyrocopters, a devastating war machine and one of the Guild's finest inventions.
As a member of the Engineers Guild, you're able to send a request to the guild's longbeards for a wing of Gyrocopters, a devastating war machine and one of the Guild's finest inventions.
A regiment of 5 war machines will arrive at your capital hold of [Root.Capital.GetName].
The Miners Guild

The Miners Guild is one of the greatest and most venerated of the craftguilds. Founded, according to tradition, by Grungni himself, this craftguild extracts metal ores and rough gemstones from the earth. The extensive tunnel complexes beneath the Dwarfholds are their domain, and a great source of pride. Dwarf miners can be found in any Dwarf settlement close to active mines.

By the grace of Grungni.
Signed, [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
column3:
Salutations, [Root.GetTitledFirstName] !
Nous sommes ravis d'apprendre que vous avez fait votre premier pas vers l'illumination. Les secrets du Corpus peuvent vous paraître obscurs, mais avec le temps vous pourrez les comprendre aussi bien que moi.

Gardez à l'esprit ce que vous voulez savoir, et [Root.GetHermesThriceBlessed], vous l'enseignera.
Signé, [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
column4:
Seid gegrüßt, [Root.GetTitledFirstName]!
Wir sind davon entzückt, zu erfahren, dass Ihr Euren ersten Schritt auf dem Weg zur Erleuchtung getan habt, [Root.GetTitle]. Die Geheimnisse des Corpus mögen Euch zwar jetzt noch verborgen sein, doch mit der Zeit werdet Ihr sie so wie ich selbst zu verstehen beginnen.

Denkt immer an das Wissen, das Euch verheißen ist, dann wird [Root.GetHermesThriceBlessed] es Euch auch lehren.
Gezeichnet

[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
column6:
Saludos, [Root.GetTitledFirstName]:
Nos complace saber que has dado tu primer paso hacia la iluminación, [Root.GetTitle]. Los secretos del Corpus pueden parecerte oscuros ahora, pero con el tiempo lograrás comprenderlos tan bien como yo.

Guarda en tu mente lo que quieres aprender, que [Root.GetHermesThriceBlessed] te enseñará.
Firmado: [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]

column2: Excellent!

While spying on [accused_apostate.GetBestName] you have found out about the hideous mutations [accused_apostate.GetSheHe] is hiding. All together you now have enough damning evidence to accuse [accused_apostate.GetHerHim] as a cursed mutant! Your [Root.GetReligionWarriorPlural] are poised and ready to bring [accused_apostate.GetHerHim] to you in chains.
column3: En espionnant [accused_apostate.GetBestName], vous avez trouvé de nombreux bibelots et livres hérétiques. Vous avez maintenant assez de preuves accablantes pour l'accuser d'apostasie - [accused_apostate.GetIlElleCap] prétend être un[accused_apostate.GetNoneE] pieu[accused_apostate.GetXSe] [accused_apostate.GetReligionMascFem], mais c'est un mensonge - [accused_apostate.GetIlElle] pratique secrètement la foi [accused_apostate.GetTrueReligionAdherent] ! Vos [Root.GetReligionWarriorPlural] sont prêts à vous l'amener enchaîné[accused_apostate.GetNoneE].
column4: Beim Ausspionieren von [accused_apostate.GetBestName] habt Ihr viele ketzerische Schmuckstücke und Bücher gefunden. Alles in allem habt Ihr nun genug belastendes Beweismaterial, um [accused_apostate.GetBestName] der Abtrünnigkeit bezichtigen zu können. [accused_apostate.GetSheHeCap] behauptet zwar, ein frommer [accused_apostate.Religion.GetName] zu sein, doch dies entspricht offenkundig nicht der Wahrheit. [accused_apostate.GetSheHeCap] übt im Geheimen [accused_apostate.GetTrueReligionAdherent] aus! Eure [Root.GetReligionWarrior] stehen bereit, um [accused_apostate.GetBestName] in Ketten zu Euch zu bringen.
column6: Mientras espiabas a [accused_apostate.GetBestName], encontraste diversas baratijas y libros heréticos. Ya has reunido suficientes pruebas incriminatorias para acusar a [accused_apostate.GetBestName] de apostasía. Afirma ser [accused_apostate.Religion.GetName], pero es obvio que miente: ¡practica [accused_apostate.GetTrueReligionAdherent] en secreto! Tus [Root.GetReligionWarrior]s están listos para traerte a esta persona encadenada.

column2: [Root.GetLordSpiritualName] [Root.job_spiritual.GetFirstName] bursts into your [Root.GetChamber], flanked by several [Root.GetReligionWarriorPlural] dragging [accused_apostate.GetBestName] with them in chains. "My [Root.GetTitle], we uncovered this thrice-cursed mutant, tainted by the Dark Powers! What shall be done with [accused_apostate.GetHerHim]?"
column3: [Root.GetLordSpiritualName] [Root.job_spiritual.GetFirstName] fait irruption dans votre [Root.GetChamber], accompagné[Root.job_spiritual.GetNoneE] de plusieurs [Root.GetReligionWarriorPlural] tirant [accused_apostate.GetBestName] enchaîné[accused_apostate.GetNoneE]. « M[Root.GetOnA][Root.GetLordLady], nous avons surpris c[accused_apostate.GetEtEtte] apostat[accused_apostate.GetNoneE] en train de lire [accused_apostate.GetTrueReligionScriptureName] de la religion [accused_apostate.TrueReligion.GetName] et louer [accused_apostate.TrueReligion.GetHighGodName] ! Que doit-on faire d[accused_apostate.GetEluiElle] ? »
column4: [Root.GetLordSpiritualName] [Root.job_spiritual.GetFirstName] stürzt in Eure [Root.GetChamber]. Mehrere [Root.GetReligionWarrior] folgen ihm und ziehen [accused_apostate.GetBestName] in Ketten hinter sich her. "Mein/e [Root.GetTitle], wir haben diese abtrünnige Person dabei ertappt, die Heilige [accused_apostate.GetTrueReligionAdherent]-Schrift [accused_apostate.GetTrueReligionScriptureName] zu lesen und [accused_apostate.GetTrueReligionHighGod] zu preisen! Was soll mit [accused_apostate.GetBestName] geschehen?"
column6: [Root.GetLordSpiritualName] [Root.job_spiritual.GetFirstName] entra gritando en tu [Root.GetChamber], flanqueado/a por varios [Root.GetReligionWarrior]s que arrastran a [accused_apostate.GetBestName] con cadenas. «Mi [Root.GetTitle], ¡sorprendimos a esta persona leyendo el/la [accused_apostate.GetTrueReligionAdherent] [accused_apostate.GetTrueReligionScriptureName] y prodigando alabanzas a [accused_apostate.GetTrueReligionHighGod]! ¿Qué deseas que se haga?».

column2: witch
sorcerer
Repeating Arquebus Range

The military engineers of Cathay are known to produce some of the finest weapons of war, where the equally skilled marksmen can equipped with them. Here they can practice with their powerful and renown repeating arquebuses.
Repeating Arquebus Range
Repeating Arquebus Range
Repeating Arquebus Range
Samurai Dojo
The fearless warriors of the Samurai caste are trained here. Covered in armor head to toe, they represent ideal lifestyle of that of a warrior in Nippon.
Samurai Dojo
Samurai Dojo
Samurai Dojo
Wasaili Pike Milita Barracks
The cosmopolitan Wasaili fight very much unlike their tribal brethren of the jungle and savannah, preferring disciplined ranks of pikemen, drawn from the citizenry of their merchant towns.
Wasaili Pike Milita Barracks
Wasaili Pike Milita Barracks
Wasaili Pike Milita Barracks
Grand Commodore
Mammoth Camp
Mammoth Camp
Mammoth Camp
Mammoth Camp
Mammoth Camp
Mammoth Camp
Mammoth Camp
Mammoth Camp
In the camp, the gigantic mammoths of Norsca and the Chaos Wastes are prepared and outfitted to take part in military campaigns.
column3: Dans ce camp, on prépare les éléphants aux campagnes militaires.
column4: In diesem Gehege werden Elefanten für den Einsatz im Krieg gehalten.
column6: En el campamento, los elefantes están preparados para tomar parte en las campañas militares.

column2: Your [GetFromRelation], [From.GetTitledFirstName], has decided to study in prestigious University of Altdorf and become learned [From.GetManWoman]! Although [From.GetSheHe] will no doubt learn something there, such education is not free.
Go and make me proud, [GetFromRelation].
I will not allow it!

Your [GetFromRelation], [From.GetTitledFirstName], has decided to study in prestigious University of Nuln and become learned [From.GetManWoman]! Although [From.GetSheHe] will no doubt learn something there, such education is not free.
Go and make me proud, [GetFromRelation].
I will not allow it!

Your [GetFromRelation], [From.GetTitledFirstName], has decided to study in prestigious University of Streissen and become learned [From.GetManWoman]! Although [From.GetSheHe] will no doubt learn something there, such education is not free.

Your [GetFromRelation], [From.GetTitledFirstName], has decided to study in prestigious University of Praag and become learned [From.GetManWoman]! Although [From.GetSheHe] will no doubt learn something there, such education is not free.

Your [GetFromRelation], [From.GetTitledFirstName], has decided to study in prestigious University of Remas and become learned [From.GetManWoman]! Although [From.GetSheHe] will no doubt learn something there, such education is not free.

Your [GetFromRelation], [From.GetTitledFirstName], has decided to study in prestigious University of Miragliano and become learned [From.GetManWoman]! Although [From.GetSheHe] will no doubt learn something there, such education is not free.

Your [GetFromRelation], [From.GetTitledFirstName], has decided to study in prestigious University of Martek and become learned [From.GetManWoman]! Although [From.GetSheHe] will no doubt learn something there, such education is not free.

Your [GetFromRelation], [From.GetTitledFirstName], has decided to study in prestigious University of Magritta and become learned [From.GetManWoman]! Although [From.GetSheHe] will no doubt learn something there, such education is not free.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has returned finished [From.GetHerHis] studies. A single look at your [GetFromRelation] tell you that [From.GetSheHe] has taken to the bottle, it makes you wonder how [From.GetSheHe] completed the studies at all.
Damn slob.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has returned finished [From.GetHerHis] studies as a changed [From.GetManWoman]. [From.GetSheHe] is wiser, more confident in his own abilities and more knowledgeable in general. It seems the time spent in studying did [From.GetHerHim] good.
Welcome home, [From.GetFirstName]!

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has returned finished [From.GetHerHis] successfully studies, although it did take a lot from [From.GetHerHim] - many sleepless nights and learning sessions have left your [GetFromRelation] depressed.
It can't be that hard.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has come home from [From.GetHerHis] studied, but [From.GetSheHe] is not alone. [From.GetSheHeCap] has found a spouse and brought [From.GetSheHeOpp] with [From.GetSheHe]. [From.GetSheHeCapOpp] seems willing to make the best of [From.GetSheHeOpp] new home.
Each to their own.
Each to their own.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has returned finished [From.GetHerHis] studies. They weren't easy and [From.GetSheHe] barely dragging [From.GetHerHis] feet. [From.GetSheHe] will have to rest for a while.
Poor child...
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has come home from [From.GetHerHis] studied. It seems [From.GetSheHe] enjoyed them seeing that [From.GetSheHe] have taken a whole mountain of books with [From.GetHerHim].
I don't think they all will fit in library.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has come home from [From.GetHerHis] studied. You decide that students life must be quite something after hearing some of your [GetFromRelation]'s outrageous stories of what exactly happened during [From.GetHerHis] so called 'study seasons'.
That's my [GetFromRelation]!

Upon learning of the death of your parent, you hastily completed the necessary paperwork to get officially finish your studies and departed for home. The journey was uneventful but finally you are home. The throne is yours.
I will put my new knowledge to good use.
Academic
This character has continued their education in one of the famous universities of the world.
On second thoughts no, he shall remain with me.
Send [Root.GetTitledFirstName] to study at an University

You can send [Root.GetTitledFirstName] to enroll as a student in one of three universities, depending on the region inside the Old World or Araby you're located in, for some years and hope they return as an enlightened academician.
You have decided to send [From.GetTitledFirstName] to a university to study, hoping they return as an enlightened academician. Where will you send [From.GetHerHim]?
To the University of Altdorf
To the University of Nuln
To the University of Streissen
To the University of Praag
To the University of Remas
To the University of Miragliano
To the University of Kufra
To the University of Magritta
On second thought, no, [From.GetTitledFirstName] stays.
Fanatics Scattered
The [Root.Religion.GetName] fanatics in [Root.Location.GetName] have been scattered, or, at least, most of them.
column3: Les habitants de [Root.Location.GetName], ou, du moins, la plupart d'entre eux, ont embrassé la foi [Root.Religion.GetName] !
column4: Die Menschen in [Root.Location.GetName], oder zumindest die meisten von ihnen, sind zum [Root.Religion.GetName]-Glauben übergetreten!
column6: ¡Los habitantes de [Root.Location.GetName], o al menos la mayoría, se han unido al [Root.Religion.GetName]!

column2: My hard work has paid off!

My liege, I am pleased to report the success of my mission to scatter the fanatics in [From.Location.GetName]. The majority of them have been convinced to give up their fervent beliefs!\nYour humble Lord Spiritual\n[From.GetTitledName]
column3: Mon suzerain, j'ai le plaisir de vous informer que ma mission à [From.Location.GetName] a porté ses fruits. La majorité des habitants se sont convertis à la foi [From.Religion.GetName] !\nVotre humble Chapelain\n[From.GetTitledName]
column4: Mein Lehnsherr, mit Freuden melde ich Euch den Erfolg meiner Mission in [From.Location.GetName]. Der Großteil der Bevölkerung ist zum [Root.Religion.GetName]-Glauben übergetreten!\nEuer ergebener Hofkaplan\n[From.GetTitledName]
column6: Mi señor, es un placer comunicarle el éxito de mi misión en [From.Location.GetName]. ¡La mayoría de sus habitantes se ha convertido al [From.Religion.GetName]!\nSu humilde capellán,\n[From.GetTitledName]

column2: Fanatic Presence
Sympathy for the Old World Pantheon
This character, though not a follower of any of the cults of the Old World, has a special sympathy for their gods, and understanding for their worshippers.
Sympathy for the Southern Pantheon
This character, though not a follower of any of the cults of Araby and the Southlands, has a special sympathy for their gods, and understanding for their worshippers.
Sympathy for the Cadai
This character, though not a follower of any the Cadai, has a special sympathy for the Asur and Asrai gods, and understanding for their worshippers.
Sympathy for the Cytharai
This character, though not a follower of any the Cytharai, has a special sympathy for the Druchii gods, and understanding for their worshippers.
Sympathy for the Ancestor Gods
This character, though not a follower of any the Ancestor Gods, has a special sympathy for the Dwarfs' ancestors, and understanding for their worshippers.
Sympathy for the Halfling Pantheon
This character, though not a follower of any the deities of the Halflings, has a special sympathy for their gods, and understanding for their worshippers.
Sympathy for the Oriental Cults
This character, though not a follower of any of the cults of the Far East, has a special sympathy for their gods, and understanding for their worshippers.
The Parade of the Idols
True to the customs of our ancestors, we parade our many gods, the Marid, once in a year so that all may bathe in their glory.
You have begun preparations for the Parade of the Idols. You send out messengers with invitations to your vassals, expecting all to come and honor [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName].
Come all, to celebrate our gods!

Dear vassal,
I hereby invite you to attend the Parade of the Idols at [From.Capital.GetName].

Your Liege,
[From.GetTitledName]
I look forward to it!
Your vassal, [From.GetTitledName], has refused your invitation to the Parade of the Idols.
Well, I don't like [From.GetHerHim] either

Guests have arrived from villages throughout the realm, to celebrate the Parade of the Idols. Already, idols to minor and foreign gods are starting to be paraded around the streets of [Root.Capital.GetName].
Let's get this party started!
The Parade of the Idols is over for this time. The Thousand Idols have been properly honoured and the realm is looking forward to a bright future under their glory.
Until next time!
The Parade of the Idols

The Parade of the Idols is about to start, and in accordance with tradition, priests and pious men carry the idols and statues of our many gods in circles around the city, distributing blessings in the name of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] and many others. To be allowed to carry one of the idols is a honor reserved for only those of great prestige and piety, as well as an event requiring strength and willpower.
Today I shall proudly carry the glory of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]!
I always enjoy watching the Parade. From a well shaded location.

As you carry the heavy idol around, you discover that it is rather more heavier that you expected. The unaccustomed weight causes you to stumble, and the statue slips out of your hands and crashes down on top of you.
Surely that's not a bad omen
As you carry the heavy idol around, the weight and the heat begin to take their toll on you. As if in a dream, you begin to hear the voices of the Marid talking, telling you secrets and mysteries.
The wisdom the Thousand is revealed to me!
With each step of the Parade, more and more of the truth of your gods is revealed. Of course this is the proper path, the path of our ancestors, how could any [Root.GetManWoman] doubt such a truth?
For the glory of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]!
What once seemed so heavy at the start now feels as light as feather. Why, you could carry this idol around all day if the priests would let you!
Strength comes from [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName].
Veneration of the Idols

After the Idols have been paraded around the city, the populace comes forward to present their sacrifices and venerations. You visit each idol in turn, praying for the straight of the Marid, venerating them with sacred offerings.
For Power and Glory!.
Collection of Offerings from the Pious

The final stage of the Parade is the collection of offerings and taxes from the pious. Every pious man is expected to give, for the greater glory of the Marid. While most give only a few coins, truly pious are expected to provide much more.\n\n As the priests wind their way towards you through the crowd, you reach for your purse. How much in offerings should you give today?
As much as I can spare, for the people need it more.
The bare minimum I can get away with.
Offerings? Bah, those soothsayers need to get a job!

The final ceremony is a grand sermon to thank our gods for their presence. It is was a rousing sermon as always, and the crowd begins the feast with great abandon. Another glorious celebration to the Marid has completed!
Praise [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]!
Holding an Idol Parade
Attending an Idol Parade
Eat [Root.GetFirstName]
The worshippers of Kukaili ritualistically devour their prisoners to honour It. Eating [Root.GetFirstName] could be a good way to show praise to the Great Devourer.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] is brought before you, at an altar to Kukaili. You start the ritual by devouring [From.GetHerHis] heart, as this will please Kukaili mostly. [From.GetSheHe] watches in horror on his last breath afterwards, you devour what's the rest of [From.GetHerHim] as well.
KUKAILI! KUKAILI! KUKAILI!

[From.GetTitledFirstName]'s tribesmen have you brought before [From.GetHerHim] and tied to an altar to their bloody god. You watch in horror as [From.GetSheHe] tears your heart out of your chest and eats it! Afterwards, all you see is darkness
Heavenly Court
Great Maw
Slayer
the Heavenly Master

Dire news! It seems that the expedition you sent to Mist-covered waters in the northwestern Great Ocean has perished... the ships are intact, but all of the men inside them have disappeared. It is as if the Mists themselves are protecting something, as most who sail there never return...\n(Sending embarked troops through the Mists of Albion will cause all of them to die instantly)
I'll be more careful next time
Do not show this warning again
The Mists of Albion

My [Root.GetTitle], a great discovery has been made! A mysterious island has suddenly appeared in the mists covered waters off the western coast of Norsca. The belicose human natives call their land "Albion". Even with the mysterious mists lifted, the island is covered heavy fog and its lands are predominantly bogs, marshes and fens hiding many horrible creatures... and ancient secrets. What more mysteries lie in the Mists of Albion?\nAlbion can now be targeted by most CBs and marriage with Albionite characters is possible.
Very interesting...
Is not a member of a disease-immune race
Follower of Grungni
This character is a devout follower of Grungni, the Ancestor God of mining and smiths, and husband of Valaya.
column3: Ce personnage est un adepte de Péroun, le dieu slave du tonnerre, aussi associé au feu, aux montagnes et à la guerre.
column4: Dieser Charakter ist Perun, dem slawischen Donnergott, treu ergeben. Er wird auch mit Feuer, Bergen und Krieg in Verbindung gebracht.
column6: Este personaje es un devoto seguidor de Perún, el dios eslavo del trueno. También se lo asocia al fuego, las montañas y la guerra.

Wise Woman
Wise Women (also known as Hags) keep oral lore of the tribes, mediate with the spirits of the steppe, and keep vigilant eye out for the taint of Chaos.
Court Scholar
Scholarship is a very appreciated skill in all the courts of the Old World. That is, except in Bretonnia.
Court Scribe
Scribes are much in demand in the Old World, and being invested with this task is seen as a great honour.
Diestro
The Diestros of Estalia are some of the most skilled swordsmen in the Old World. It's a title only bestowed upon the greatest duelists in the realm.
Court Herald
Bretonnian nobles, pompous as they are, like to name Heralds from amongst their entourage to continuously recite their long titles.
Chief Goldsmith
Being named the Chief Goldsmith of a court is a great honour for any Dwarf. The goldsmiths are artisans known for carving great works of art.
Chief Prospector
To a Dwarf, mining is a great enterprise. Being named Chief Prospector of the Hold's mining efforts by it's lord is a great honour.
Gameplay options

At the dawn of time, it is said that the two Old Ones battled to decide what would be the laws upon which the Universe revolves. Unable to reach a consensus, they split Reality in half, so that those who sought canon over freedom and their opposites could both be pleased by inscribing their preference upon this magic tablet...\n\nThere are two ways to play the Warhammer mod. Option A: Player cannot marry outside of his race, and no one can switch to another race's religion. Option B: Player only (not AI) can marry outside of his race, and with some notable exceptions, it is possible for races to change religions. Way of Life DLC seductions are also less restrictive.
A - I want a purely canon experience
B - I value player choice over canon sometimes
The Embrace of Uncle Nurgle

The Plague Father, Fly Lord, Great Corrupter, the Master of Pestilence... Grandfather Nurgle has many titles. Within your very mind and soul you hear the maddened buzzing of a billion flies, and a chorus of choking, coughing voices whispering in your ears. They are calling you to join them in the endless bliss of utter pestilence and decay, to cast aside the facade of health and embrace the utter rottenness that is the inevitable fate of all life.
Father Nurgle loves his children, hehehe...
[Root.Religion.GetRandomGodNameCap] will give me the strength to resist this sickness in my heart!
The Seductions of the Prince of Pleasure

Truth, beauty, honour, justice... what do any of these things mean without pleasure? Are not the senses of Man his guide into the divine? Poetry, music, dance, wine, none of it is enough for one of your intellect and needs. Your body and mind yearn for stimulation, to seek out new experiences. You tire of the restraints of so-called "civilised society,and wonder if it might be better to seek out like-minded spirits and experiment with a new lifestyle beyond mere mortal hedonism? Your inquiring mind and almost uncontrollable lust for life leads you to the Forbidden Lord of Excess, Slaanesh, who can offer you all you desire in return for so little?
Ah, what sweet ecstasy is this? I must have more!
No, no, I have gone too far... [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodNameCap] forgive me.
The Changer of Ways Calls Ye

The ignorant masses cling to their Gods and laws, unaware of their own utter insignificance in the grand scheme of things. Civilisations and races rise and fall, the only constant is change - all else is illusion. One of your genius knows that the only way to survive and achieve greatness on this mortal coil is to understand the vast immaterial power of magic, and to use any means necessary to acquire that knowledge. You know that the parlour tricks of the common wizards are merely a pale reflection of the incredible powers that close-minded religious dogma denies to you. In order to better understand the Winds of Magic, and to further your own career, you've considered entering a purely temporary relationship with the daemon called Tzeentch in order to use him for your own ends.
Knowledge is power.
Some secrets must be hidden forever.
The Eight-Fold Path

Weakness, all you see around you is weakness and corruption. Peace breeds excess, only war is pure. Every day you spend you long for the clash of arms, the splatter of fresh blood on your face, to see your enemies' homesteads in flames and their warriors in flight. Better that than to forever be surrounded by whining, ungrateful vassals and forced to listen to the false advice of effete scholars and sorcerers. Kill them, kill them all! Khorne, Master of the Skull Throne, calls you to his service. It matters not from whence the blood flows, only that it does.
BLOOD FOR THE BLOOD GOD, SKULLS FOR THE SKULL THRONE!!!
What am I thinking?! I'm a warrior, not a butcher!
The Power of Chaos

Everywhere those in power seek to blind the teaming mass of Mankind to the horrors that lurk just out of sight. The Blood God, the Changer of Ways, the Prince of Pleasure and the Great Corrupter are all names for a unspeakable force that was ancient when the mountains and the seas were young. Fools deny it, but the Ruinous Powers are very real. Those who serve them well are rewarded, or else are damned for eternity. Do you dare sell your soul to Chaos Undivided, the Primordial Annihilator - and risk all for the sake of immortality and an escape from death itself?
[Root.Religion.GetRandomGodNameCap]? Bah, these are the real Gods!
My faith in [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodNameCap] in unshakeable!
The Cult

You hurry through the streets, scurrying like a common criminal through the backstreets and the slums, a hood obscuring your face from sight. But you are no common thief or mere conspirator, you serve a greater power. You duck and weave your way to arranged meeting place, whispering a password in a forbidden language. Inside, you are greeted by your new brothers and sisters, and after a blood curdling ritual test you are finally inaugurated into the cult.
It's too late to turn back now...
You were infected with Tomb Rot, and your body has started rotting.
Oh no!
A miracle! You were cured of Tomb Rot.
Bless the Gods!.
A miracle! You were cured of Creeping Buboes.
Bless the Gods!.
A miracle! You were cured of Green Pox.
Bless the Gods!.
A miracle! You were cured of Red Pox.
Bless the Gods!.
A miracle! You were cured of Rattlelung.
Bless the Gods!.
A miracle! You were cured of Bone Ague.
Bless the Gods!.
Hidden
You have been blessed with a long life, but now you feel your time has come to leave this world.
I die in peace...
Illness weakens your once strong body, you feel that your last moment has come. You take your final breath.
Ah...
Signs of Armageddon
The signs on heaven and earth are indicating an approaching doom. Foul mutants seems to be more common now, despite the best efforts to isolate and burn them out...
Yes indeed, something is happening...

The power of the Dark Gods is rising. Daemonic legions find it easier to enter this world to spread destruction and taint all that is holy. They readily join your forces to help you in your crusade...
The world will fall!
You feel that influence of Dark Powers is getting weaker with each day. The daemonic forces that march with you slowly disappear.
Why have you forsaken me?
The dark crusade has begun! The world will tremble! The believers of the false gods will drown in their own blood!
For glory!
The armies of Chaos march through the world, spreading destruction in the name of the Dark Gods. The doom is coming... in such conflict one must take a side.
LET THE WORLD BURN!.
I will never yield before Chaos.
That is not our war...

Signs in the heavens and on earth tell of the coming End of Days. Mutations appear rampant and beastman attacks are more frequent than ever despite the best efforts. You hear rumours of terrible events occurring in distant lands, hopefully exaggerated or false.
The [From.GetTitledFirstName] beg for your help against the armies of Chaos. What is your answer?
In this dark hour we will stand up to the challenge!.
This war isn't ours to fight.
Your mighty host is passing through the lands of those who are not currently at war with you, however the Dark Gods would be pleased if they too felt your wrath...
Drown them in their own blood! Pillage and burn in the name of the Gods!
Their time will come... try to pass unnoticed.
Armies of Chaos are marching. The host of [From.GetTitledFirstName] is ravaging your lands. What will you do?
Let them pass.
You failed to cast the spell, however thanks to your mastery over Winds you are unharmed.
You were unable to control the Winds of Magic, the chaotic streams of magic left you burnt and scarred.
A terrible mistake during spellcasting exposed you to the power of Ruinous Powers, you scream from pain when raw magical energies twist and damage your body.
Character gains a mutation.
Across the field of battle you have spotted an enemy worth facing.
Who shall I fight today?
As you draw closer you see your enemy is [From.GetTitledName]. Shall you engage [From.GetHerHim]?
I shall defeat [From.GetHerHim]!
The enemy reacts!
Discretion is the better part of valour!
The battle is not yet won... Your enemy did [From.GetHerHis] move and you may and assess the combat situation and choose a proper response:
Continue Combat
Cast Spell
Counterspell or Channel Magic Power
Continue Combat
Try to escape!
I cannot move!
[From.GetTitledFirstName] managed to escape the battlefield, shaming [From.GetHerHim]self forever!
The coward has escaped... for now.
Focus on defence. Let no attack through!
Focus on offence. Attack without restraint!
Balance your defence and offence. Overcompensation will lead to ruin!

column1: # THOSE OPTIONS ARE FOR ALL EVENTS 20-23

column2: Cast Offensive Spell
Cast Defensive Spell
Cast Buff Spell
Cast Lore Special Spell
Channel Magic Power
Perform Counterspell
Wait
You decided to engage in physical combat. You will fight your enemy and hopefully injure him. What stance you prefer?
You are preparing a spell - this time you won't fight your enemy in physical combat. What spell do you wish to cast?
You decided to channel magical energies to regain power and be able to cast spells, however you will not deal any damage to enemy this round.
Enemy immobilized you. You cannot do anything this round.
Unable to continue, you succumb to your wounds...
Avenge me!
You have won! The body of [From.GetTitledName] lies before you.
Hurray!
You have lost the battle... Wounded and weak you managed to escape...
Run!
You have won! However [From.GetTitledName] has managed to escape!
A coward through and through!

Radiant Weapon - character weapon becomes blessed: +2 Att against Chaos, 2 mp.
Shardstorm - throws ice shards at enemy: S=7, 3 mp.
Crystal Cloak - creates a mist of swirling ice around character: +1 Def, -1 Att/Def for enemy, costs 3 mp.
Ice Sheet - covers the terrain with slippery ice. Disturbs enemy -1 Att/Def, enemy cannot escape, 2 mp
Ice Maiden Kiss - damages S=8 and immobilizes the enemy for the next round 5 mp.
Drain Life - damages S=6 and heals caster +1 hp, 4 mp.
Hellish Vigour - heals character +1hp and improves defence +1 Def 3 mp.
Hand of Dust - damages S = Att, and weaken the enemy -1 Att/Def 2 mp.
Siphon Life - damages enemy S=6, heals +1hp or gives magic points +5mp, costs 4 mp.
