Hide My Cultist
The White Wind of Magic Hysh can cure mental and physical injures. White Mages are both healers and relentless Daemon Hunters. What would you like to heal?
Cure injuries
Cure illness
Apply Hysh's blessing
You start the exorcism, the streaks of Hysh entangle the Daemon and the spiritual struggle begins... Let the light guide you!
Begone daemon!
You fight side by side with your troops, banishing daemons, burning your foes with streaks of Hysh and healing the wounded. Wherever you show up a new hope arises.
Your enemy has aid of the White Winds of Magic on their side, wherever the Hierophants show up enemy troops are healed and your forces burn in blinding light.
Die unholy creatures!
You have successfully cast the spell Burning Gaze. Your gaze focuses radiant power on the enemy, wounding and perhaps dazing them as well.
You have successfully cast the spell Body of Light. Your body shines with an intensely bright light, making you difficult to look upon. Your enemy will have difficulty attacking you.
You have successfully cast the spell Healing Energy. Light fills your wounds, healing them and bringing you back into the fight

You have successfully cast the spell Radiant Weapon. You infuse your weapon with the radiant energy of Hysh. It now glows with a pure white light, allowing you attack more effectively and doing additional damage against daemons.

Ice Mages get their power from the icy land of Kislev they can unleash blizzards and freezing winds at their enemies, turn people into frozen statues or freeze the land. Which spell from the Lore of Ice would you like to cast?
Summon blizzard to surrounding lands
Raise ice walls for defence
Send icestorm to besiegers
Send icestorm to defenders

You summon the power of ice and unleash the mighty blizzard upon your enemies. The blizzard will last for many days slowing the enemy march and weakening its forces. Where you want to direct the blizzard?
Send the blizzard to nearby lands...
Let the icestorm stay here
Walls of solid ice grow out of the ground, providing additional defence in strategic locations in the settlement.
You send hail and biting winds to strike the enemy army. Their soldiers weaken and die from the extreme weather, and the harsh conditions are affecting the their ability to fight.
You send hail and biting winds to strike the defending enemy. Soldiers freeze solid and shatter from the terrible storm. The enemy army is losing their spirit.
An unnatural hail and biting wind come out of the sky and struck your army. Soldiers freeze solid and shatter from the terrible storm, and they find themselves losing heart.
Nooo!
Blizzard is sent to [This.GetName].
Ice walls are formed in the holding, spell lasts up to two months.

As you intone the dread syllables handed down from Nagash himself, you feel the Winds of Magic surge around you. This arcane energy breathes unlife into the dead creatures that lie before you. Long dead cadavers claw themselves from the ground while recently dead bodies prop themselves up on rotting limbs. These undead creatures now await your command.

Using the power of Dhar you summon a Wind of deadly Dark Magic that kills anyone that it encounters. The victims experience extreme agony as the spell rips their very soul form their body, leaving them a lifeless husk.
Using your dark powers you raise soldiers that have fallen in battle. Now they have the unique honour of serving you again in undeath.
Rise and serve me forever!
Cast Spell
Stop Casting

column1: # SYLVANIA EVENTS I DONT KNOW IF THOSE ARE CORRECT

column2: Sylvania is a dangerous place for all live, but a lovely country if you are a vampire.
I'll rule on this accursed land.
I've found my perfect lair.
My holdings are suffering from the influence of this accursed land. Dead men refuse to stay in the ground while huge flocks of what look like bats darken the skies.
Damn. I can't do anything to stop it.
With hard work and the blessings of the gods, the lands of Sylvania are approaching normalcy. Crops grow and the peasants live safely under my watch.
I'm a great ruler.
With my powerful magic, Sylvania is getting stronger. The dead will rise again and more servants will come to me.
I will live for eternity.
I've not paid enough attention to the care of my land, and now my loyal servants have dispersed, pursued by fanatical zealots and crusading templars.
I don't care of mortal affairs.
I've conquered this land, and will now fill the ranks of my armies with the dead. I can also draw out the hidden cultists and necromancers that awaited my arrival.
I'm unstoppable.

I've conquered this land, but now I must deal with the mindless undead roaming about, the ghouls infesting the gravesites, and I'm sure there are foul necromancers and lesser vampires hiding amongst my vassals...
I shall prevail.
Send money to a loyal Sigmarite to fight the accursed undead.
Send the money.
Don't send the money.
Grand Theogonist [From.GetFirstName] has send us money to fight undead.
I'll waste it well.
What will I do with the money the Grand Theogonist sent me?
Hire some adventurers. No one will miss them if they fail.
I'll lead a hunting party, it is only right that I deal with this.
I'll keep the money for me.
A strange hooded man approaches you, offering you his services to fight the dangers of Sylvania.
Let him in, as he will serve me well.
I don't trust strangers, send him far away.
Witch! Burn him!
There is a chance that the man escapes, wounding you in gratitude for your hospitality.
No, I'll attack somewhere else.

For too long, you have bided your time. Now your great spell is complete, and you have raised an army of undead to take on what's left of the Empire. Let the blood flow, and let those who will not serve you in life - serve you in death!
Rumours reach you that in Sylvania a vampire lord by the name of Vlad von Carstein has summoned a massive army of undead, and aims to make war on the fragmented empire.
With the death of Vlad von Carstein, the undead armies he had raised return to the ground, undead no more... there may be hope for the Empire yet!
No, I'll decide my own path of expansion.
Your empire and armies keep growing, and you are ready to move against Nordland, securing that flank against any counter-attack. You raise more undead for your armies.
No, I'll decide my own path of expansion.
Your empire and armies keep growing, and you are ready to move against Westerland, in preparation for the final assault against Altdorf. You raise more undead for your armies.
Rumours reach you that in the distant land of Sylvania, a powerful vampire by the name of Vlad von Carstein has summoned a massive army of undead, and makes war on the fragmented empire.
No, I'll decide my own path of expansion.
You have conquered Ostermark. Now you should move west, towards the imperial capitals and cripple the Empire while it is still divided! You raise more undead for your armies.
No, I'll decide my own path of expansion.

You have conquered large parts of the empire - now it is time to move further into Hochland, destroying the weaker foes before moving west against the major seats of imperial power. You raise more undead for your armies.
No, I'll decide my own path of expansion.
Your empire has grown to a great size now, and you are ready to move towards Middenland, heading for the ancient Imperial capital of Middenheim itself. You raise more undead for your armies.
No, I'll decide my own path of expansion.
Your empire and armies keep growing, and you are ready to move northwards, securing that flank against any counter-attack. You raise more undead for your armies.

Vile treachery - you awaken from your coffin one evening, and find your precious ring stolen! You are now no longer able to return from death over and over again, and you may have to slow the rate of your expansion so as to not risk your life...
Rumours reach your realm that the mighty von Carstein ring which made this tyrant unkillable has been stolen, and he has not managed to retrieve it... there is hope now, that he can be stopped.
With the final death of Vlad von Carstein, the undead armies he had raised return to the ground, undead no more... This is a terrible blow, let's hope we can hold the realm together without them.
Risen again!
With the power of the von Carstein ring, you are able to return to life despite wounds that would destroy other vampires. This is a painful process, but one your enemies have no counter to!

The Everchosen is the champion of all the Chaos gods. You can journey to the Altar of Ultimate Darkness in distant Naggaroth to seek the favour of the Chaos Gods. The stronger the Winds of Chaos are, the more likely they are to give you their mark.
I wonder how strong the Winds of Chaos are...
You make your way across the wastes, into the northern limits of Naggaroth, where stories tell of the Altar of Ultimate Darkness. Finally, after many trials, you reach your destination...
Yes, I will march alongside the Everchosen!
No, I will never march with that fool.
An Everchosen has been selected, and a great war is being prepared. Daemons of the Dark Gods march under their banner - surely you yourself should also march to war alongside this new champion?
Yes, I will face their terror even so!
No, perhaps now is not the time...
The Winds of Chaos are weak at the moment, and the Ruinous Powers are unlikely to grant you their blessing. Do you still wish to proceed?
Yes, I will face their terror even so!
No, perhaps now is not the time...
The Winds of Chaos are only moderately strong at the moment, and the Ruinous Powers are less likely to grant you their blessing. Do you still wish to proceed?
No, perhaps now is not the time...
The Winds of Chaos are  strong at the moment, and the Ruinous Powers are likely to grant you their blessing. Do you wish to proceed?
No, perhaps now is not the time...
The Winds of Chaos are very strong at the moment, and the Ruinous Powers are almost certain to grant you their blessing if you pass their trials. Do you wish to proceed?
I will prove myself worthy - charge!

Upon entering the temple you are beset by nightmarish visions, testing your faith to its very core. Your mind is strong enough to persevere, and finally you come to the test... you must defeat the Champion of the Gods to receive their mark!
Urrrghh! No... not ... like this!

Upon entering the temple you are beset by nightmarish visions, and attacked by daemons of all sorts! You cannot hold on, the Gods are displeased at your trespass, and soon you are surrounded fighting desperately for your life!

You have won the duel against the champion, and you finally kneel before the Altar of Ultimate Darkness, and receive the mark of the Dark Gods. 'Rise... Everchosen... and conquer in our name' a terrible unison of four voices growls in your head...
Let all bow before the Everchosen!

You return to your lands, bearing the mark of the Gods. Across the wastes, word spreads like wildfire: An Everchosen has been selected, and armies of daemons march by [From.GetHerHis] side! They would be fools not to join you now in the coming war...
You have reached the age where you can no longer have children.
You can feel that this will be your last child.
You can feel that this will be your last child.
I could have done just as well.

While patrolling your lands, a courtier won a great victory when cornered by a dozen bandits. [From.GetSheHeCap] slew half of them, and the rest fled. The court is hailing [From.GetHerHim] as a great warrior!
While patrolling your lands, a courtier was ambushed, but fled and left [From.GetHerHis] men to die! [From.GetHerHisCap] name is in disgrace.
We must send for a Witch Hunter.
No, Witch Hunters cause too much trouble.

A shadowy group of cultists are alleged to have formed in one of your holdings, performing dark rituals and even summoning daemons if the rumours are true! Your people beg you to root them out, but what can men do against such dark magic?

You are one of the tomb kings of Nehekhara, a powerful ruler of a long-dead realm whose glories have long since faded. Yet still you endure, still you stand guard over the ancient glories of the past, and perhaps - the future glories yet to come.
I serve forever, even in death.

You are one of the Liche Priests of Nehekhara, a powerful priest watching over the Tomb Kings and their treasures. Your oath compels you to serve eternally, even in death, to advance the desires of your immortal god-kings.

Your dynasty stretches back thousands of years, but most of the ancient kings and queens of your line are asleep in their great tombs. It is time to awaken some of them, so that if you should perish, they can take up the rule of your lands.
Orc reproduction remains a mystery, but every dynasty needs heirs and these are close kin of yours and will inherit your possessions upon your death.
Orcs and goblins grow in size from the number of battles they have fought in and won. As you have reached the age of adulthood, your size is...
With each victory in battle, you grow a little in size and strength!
Today, your favourite grot dropped your best choppa on his foot when the handle came off...
Ya stupid git ruined ma best choppa!
ZOG IT!!
After doing your daily drops, you notice a goblin attempting to make away with a heavy, double bladed choppa...
Oi! Dat's mine! Git 'im, lads!
Meh, zog it...
Woit... Lessee wher' 'is stash is...
You cunningly tail the goblin back to his stash... As sneakily as an orc can...
After a near un-orc-ish display of cunning brutality, you stand before the goblin's secret stash, a pile of pilfered weaponry which must have taken several goblin generations to collect...
Da's gonna git me a big bag 'o teef...!
Oi'm 'now a few lads who'd loik a gud choppa...
In times of war, it's not uncommon for orc shamans to join a Warboss's retinue, so that they may witness their nascent legend.
Wot? Jus' tell 'im ta stay outta mah way!!
Oi'm not sure 'bout dat... Wot if he makes meeb head splode?
Some goblin told me I could get myself a lot more fungus beer if I planted the fungus on my own personal dropping ground...
Gud Idea, Skumzog!
Wot if we try ta stick you in da ground instead?
The boyz look around all shifty-eyed at the Fungus beer you "cultivate".
Dats it, lads! Drink up! Wot? Don't mind da aftertaste...
Make me wonda... Wot if I use da fungus dowots instead...
Maybe your brews will be liked better if they don't contain rotting goblin...
I recently placated an upstart orc by tanking him full with booze...
Have anuvva, boyz!
I could make me a right gud fungus wine outta dis...
There's nothing more orcish then getting stinking drunk!
Da gobbo's I planted aren't making fer very gud beer...
...But dey look zoggin' nice on me lawn!
Mebbeh I should plant fungus instead...
Since I put Skumzog's head on a stick, no goblin has tried making away with any of my choppas.
If Oi put up more, Oi bet dey won't even shit in me lawn!
Dat's da spirit!
The boyz have been strangely motivated lately...
Dats jus' cuz I'm da best brewer in da camp.
Me' garden showed 'em wots wot!

You could have sworn you had a holding here,but there's nothing left. As you wonder what could have happened,you see the fortress flying over your head with wings of stone and disappearing in the the distance.
While raiding this province, you manage to round up a sizeable number of slaves. You can either sell them via a separate decision, or else use them in your own demesne provinces.
I wish to use them in my provinces.
I wish to sell them
You have slaves in your possession. You can either sell them, or else use them in your demesne's provinces.
Send my human slaves to work in [From.Location.GetName].
Send my elf slaves to work in [From.Location.GetName].
Send my dwarf slaves to work in [From.Location.GetName].
I do not wish to send them anywhere.
You have decided to send some of your slaves to compliment the workforce of [From.Location.GetName]. Which ones will you send?
Send my human slaves to where my steward is.
Send my elf slaves to where my steward is.
Send my dwarf slaves to where my steward is.
You have slaves in your possession. What slaves, and where do you wish to send them?
Sell my human slaves
Sell my elf slaves
Sell my dwarf slaves
You have slaves in your possession. Which ones do you wish to sell?
Word reaches you that the people are beginning to whisper - are you in league with the forces of Chaos? People question your righteousness, and this is a dangerous position to be in.
People no longer question your righteousness. Your recent actions seem to have quelled the suspicion surrounding you.
Word reaches you that the people are almost convinced that are you in league with the forces of Chaos. People question your righteousness. This is a very dangerous position to be in.
People still question, but are no longer convinced that you are a cultist or a heretic. Your recent actions seem to have quelled the suspicion surrounding you.

Even your own vassals now whisper against you and the stories of your alleged heretical inclinations grow larger with each telling. They have no proof, but you can see it in their eyes that they no longer trust you and even hate and fear you.

As you are in your liege's court, your liege confront you one evening with a retinue of guards. 'It is time...' your vampire overlord says, '...for you to join me in the darkness...' you can't escape, there is no choice now.
This courtier has been turned into a loyal vampire minion now.
Your liege is a vampire, so why should you have to suffer and die as a mortal? Why not just join the ruling caste fully, and embrace the darkness in return for life eternal?
First death, then eternal life, my new minion...
First death, then eternal life, my new minion...
One of your vassals has asked you for the dark gift, and swears eternal fealty if you would but grant this heartfelt desire.
Your liege bestows the dark gift upon you, and bids you serve faithfully until the end of your days.
Your liege refuses your request, saying that you are not worthy. Your skills are lacking, and you are too thoroughly unimpressive to join the illustrious ranks of the vampire aristocracy.
Make this vampire part of my dynasty.

You can make a vampire part of your own dynasty by giving him or her the minor title 'Vampire Heir Target' and then click on the event option below. Remember to remove the minor title after you have used it.
Your liege has decided to formally welcome you into his dynasty.
You are a powerful ruler, it is time to make some heirs of your dynasty. You will scour the land for worthy candidates and then turn them and call them children.
You are a powerful ruler, it is time to make some heirs of your dynasty. You will scour the land for worthy candidates and then turn them and call them children.
You are a powerful ruler, it is time to make some heirs of your dynasty. You will scour the land for worthy candidates and then turn them and call them children.
Yes, send an invitation to my court...
No, do not bother me with this again.
A character in your realm is particularly skilled, and might make a worthy recipient of the dark gift.
You are a powerful ruler, it is time to make some heirs of your dynasty. You will scour the land for worthy candidates and then turn them and call them children.

You are summoned to a vampire lord's court. The way the invitation arrived, with no explanation, makes you pretty certain that you are going to be turned into a vampire if you go... it has happened before to others...
First death, then eternal life, my new minion...
Your guest arrives. It is time to bestow the dark gift!
Word reaches you that your intended recipient for the dark gift has fled your realm, rather than become a vampire.
Yes, send an invitation to my court...
No, do not bother me with this again.

It is often safest to have your highest ranked vassals become vampires themselves, so that they know that their fortunes are tied to your own success. Do you want to start turning your most powerful vassals?
Never! I will fight for my life!

You are summoned to your vampire liege's court. The way the invitation arrived, with no explanation, makes you pretty certain that you are going to be turned into a vampire if you go... it has happened before to others...
First death, then eternal life, my new minion...
Your guest arrives. It is time to bestow the dark gift!
So be it! You will serve me in death then!
Your vassal has refused your invitation, sending word: 'I will fight to the death, rather than submit to your eternal curse!'
While unlife certainly has its benefits, the being under the thumb of your vampiric "fatheris not one of them. After various indignities, your resentment has finally reached a tipping point.
While unlife certainly has its benefits, the being under the thumb of your vampiric "motheris not one of them. After various indignities, your resentment has finally reached a tipping point.
TEXTNAME
Widowed
This character is grief-stricken and mourning a lost spouse.
My grief is too great to sustain this marriage...
...I'm afraid it must come to an end.
Time passes, yet to me the world seems unreal. It is if a life without [From.GetFirstName] is but a mummer's farce. I am lost in this sea of loneliness and know not where to turn.
Drown yourself in wine, women, and song
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] becomes a hedonist, duellist, falconer, or hunter.
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] involves himself in a drunken quarrel and loses.
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] increases in combat skill.
Lose yourself in books, songs, and the wisdom of others
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] gives up [Root.GetHerHis] worldly titles and takes the vows
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] becomes a scholar, mystic, or poet
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] becomes a man of great intelligence
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] decreases in combat skill
Seek solace in the arms of another
This is nonsense. I will move on with my life.
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] becomes wroth, proud, cynical, or cruel
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] becomes authoritative or rude
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] becomes selfish or stubborn
As time slips by, I feel old wounds healing. I can look back now on the cherished memories, and not be absorbed in the painful ones.
I am ready to move on with my life
[From.GetSheHeCap] was a fraud anyway.

A dangerous horde of Beastmen has been flocking in [From.GetName]. The twisted Chaos creatures are being driven into a frenzy by their flea-ridden leaders and have taken arms to overcome the province.
They won't!
Once again the Corrupter has come back to life, once again hordes of Beastmen flock to his tattered banner, marching to destroy anything they find on their path.
They won't!
A rabid horde of Beastmen has emerged from the wilderness threatening to spoil and destroy anything they find on their path.
They won't!
The corrupting claw of the Shadowgave has touched this province, despoiling it of all that is orderly and natural.
Forrrwaarrrgdh!
The corrupting claw of the Shadowgave has touched [FromFrom.GetName], despoiling it of all that is orderly and natural.
Monsters!
The corrupting claw of the Shadowgave has touched [FromFrom.GetName], despoiling it of all that is orderly and natural.
Monsters!
Dissimulate Deformity
Employ the Winds of Magic to remove whatever is tarnishing your beauty.

For too long this deformity has disturbed your gracious looks. Once the proper rituals have been completed, you feel the Winds of Magic shrouding the touch of Chaos, leaving your body to look clean and pure as it was.

Calling upon the Winds of Magic you weave the proper incantations to refill the gaps and cuts filling your face, shrouding the disfigurement which plagues it and leaving your skin again as a pristine surface.
You can no longer stand to move around in a bloated formless body, luckily dark magic offers an easy solution and with a few gestures and words, you can sport once again nimble and tight limbs.

You've grown tired of the pale and hollow look on your face and of your bones sticking out under your skin, luckily magic has many uses and, with a proper spell, you can show once more a healthy appearance.
Finally.
Something must have backfired in your spell. The woven incantation reshaping your appearance is falling apart, showing once more the consequences of your indulgence on your body.
Something must have backfired in your spell. The woven incantation reshaping your appearance is falling apart, showing once more the consequences of your deprivation on your body.
Something must have backfired in your spell. The woven incantation reshaping your appearance is falling apart, showing the disgusting disfigurement spoiling your features.
Something must have backfired in your spell. The woven incantation hiding the mark of Chaos on your flesh is falling apart and cruel spines sprout once more from your skin.
Something must have backfired in your spell. The woven incantation hiding the mark of Chaos on your flesh is falling apart and twisted horns sprout once more from your forehead.
Something must have backfired in your spell. The woven incantation hiding the mark of Chaos on your flesh is falling apart and sharp scales cut their way over your skin once more.
Something must have backfired in your spell. The woven incantation hiding the mark of Chaos on your flesh is falling apart and the third eye opens again on your forehead.

Something must have backfired in your spell. The woven incantation hiding the mark of Chaos on your flesh is falling apart, you frantically try to speak as the long blackened tongue sprouts once more from your mouth.
Something must have backfired in your spell. The woven incantation hiding the mark of Chaos on your flesh is falling apart and rough crests sprout once more to cover your head.
Curses!
[FromFrom.GetFirstName] has left these lands, migrating with [FromFrom.GetHerHis] warherd elsewhere.
Free!!
Warherd Rallied ( Beastmen )

Scourging and spoiling the land of [Root.Location.GetName] you've extended the fame of your Lord. More Beastmen gather around the ruins of the civilizations that once occupied this land, breeding and cursing the gods of Men and Elves.
Grrlooodhhh...

Scourging and spoiling the land of [From.Location.GetName] you've extended your fame as a Hordemaster. More Beastmen gather around the ruins of the civilizations that once occupied this land, breeding and cursing the gods of Men and Elves.
Grrlooodhhh...
Marshal Depletes Resources ( Beastmen )
The land of [Root.Location.GetName] is barren wasteland where nothing grows and no semblance of order remains and the herd is growing restless for new places to plunder and scourge.
Grmmpfh...
The land of [From.Location.GetName] is barren wasteland where nothing grows and no semblance of order remains and the herd is growing restless for new places to plunder and scourge.
Mroove the Hrrrdh!...
Krrpp heerre...
To the victor the spoils. The Beastmen follow the strongest and, by killing the previous leader, some herds are rallying under your banner.
[From.GetFirstName] has killed [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName], one of your servants, and taken [From.GetHerHis] place as leader of the Warherd.
Hmpf.
With the death of [From.GetFirstName], you [From.GetHerHis] great horde is dividing, the various herds roaming on their own ways, seeking new places to pillage and spoil.
Overrrhh...
[From.GetFirstName] has challenged you in front of all your followers. You must defend your right to rule the Warherd.
Come heerrre!
Marshal Plunders and Increases Fame( Beastmen )
Scourging and spoiling the land of [Root.Location.GetName] you've extended the fame of your Lord. Civilization crumbles under the hooved steps of the blessed children of Chaos.
Scourging and spoiling the land of [From.Location.GetName] you've extended your fame as a Hordemaster. Civilization crumbles under the hooved steps of the blessed children of Chaos.
Grooodhh!...
Spread Chaos
Send your herds to wreak havoc in a province, destroying anything that the civilized people hold dear and increasing your prestige as a Hordemaster.
Gather Beastmen Army
Beastmen are countless and they gather easily whenever there's blood to be spilled.
Your Hordemaster stands before you, ready to defend [From.GetHerHis] right to rule.
Breaaahh!!
Join Morghur
The call of the Corrupter is strong. You can join Morghur in his quest to destroy the pitiful Elves of Athel Loren.
The Gods favour you! Their touch has given you clarity to see the Winds of magic.
Raaaahhh!!
Bray Shaman
Bray Shamans are born into magic and wield it with an instinctive ease. A palpable miasma of fell sorcery surrounds them, and when their wrath is roused, reality itself is distorted and maimed.
The Gods have blessed your spawn. It shall grow to become a powerful shaman.
Grrlooodhhh...

Herds of Beastmen are running amok in this province, spreading Chaos and destruction.
Herds of Beastmen are running amok in this province, spreading Chaos and destruction.
Herds of Beastmen are running amok in this province, spreading Chaos and destruction.
This province is scourged by a massive Beastmen population. It is only right that your liege fund an expedition to cleanse it from these blasphemous monsters.
I will plead for it at once.
The land of [From.Location.GetName] is scourged by a massive Beastmen infestation. Your subjects have pleaded many times for you to fund an expedition to cleanse them.
Sounds reasonable.
We cannot spare anything for this.
Your soldiers did their job and exterminated every last one of the Beastmen still scourging your land.
Good.
The expedition had catastrophic results: not only the Beastmen repelled your forces, the battle has sent them into a frenzy, if they gain further momentum, they might turn into a full horde.
We must prepare ourselves!

The Ruinous Powers have touched you holding and their presence has been made apparent on your newborn [GetFromRelation]. The infant has come to life deformed, screeching from a beast's mouth. Many in your court demand for the creature to be burned immediately.

The gods have blessed your household, your newborn [GetFromRelation] shows their favour in [From.GetHerHis] proud animalistic features. Yet there are some in the court claiming the child's place is not in this world.
The child stays.
We'll leave it in the forest.
This thing will burn.
Harbouring Turnskin
Abandoned Turnskin
You've chosen to focus your delightful attention unto your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName]. What do you think would you be best to improve [From.GetHerHis] character?
I don't like how [From.GetSheHe] looks.
I don't like how [From.GetSheHe] behaves.
I've changed my mind, [From.GetSheHe] bores me.
[From.GetFirstName] is certainly a champion in excess and indulgence. There's little [From.GetSheHe] won't try for the sake of pleasure.
[From.GetFirstName] is no stranger to the sublime search for pleasure, taking risks and frequently trying to reach new forms of excess.
It can be argued [From.GetFirstName] has a few interesting quirks, but [From.GetSheHe] overall sports a dull character, still too shy to experience true pleasure.
[From.GetFirstName] has to be one of the dullest persons in the world. Exceeding neither in vice nor in virtue, [From.GetSheHe] might certainly be in need for some improvement.
[From.GetFirstName] is not known for any specific virtue, but [From.GetSheHe] appears to have no experience in the delights of excess, either. This seems to be little short of an average person.
[From.GetFirstName] has certainly a reputation for intransigent behaviour and a prudish attitude. Someone really in need of dedicated attention.
[From.GetFirstName] is a pure and kind soul, dull and prudish, unable to understand the joys of real life. It will take a lot of effort to pierce [From.GetHerHis] stuck up attitude.
[From.GetFirstName] has such a plain and transparent reputation, it almost fascinates, in a way. This has to be one of the purest creatures in the entire world, well worthy of some retouching.

Your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] has spent a lot of time in the past days praising your good looks, claiming your features are falling just short of perfection.
Of course, that's how it is.
I think you're overstating things.

You could hardly believe what your heard when [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] questioned your appearance openly. Now it looks like it won't even be the last time [From.GetSheHe] spouts shrouded insults to your looks.
I cannot deny it, [From.GetSheHe]'s right.
How dare [From.GetSheHe]?
Your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] just summoned you and spent a good hour reprimanding you publicly, yelling your appearance is disgraceful and that you must do something to improve it.
Yes, I will!
I don't like your tone.

Your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] approached you in the last days, speaking about shared interests, but the more you are with [From.GetHerHim] the more [From.GetSheHe] seems to diverge to some unpleasant topics, as if [From.GetSheHe] were trying to encourage you to delve into such repulsive thoughts.
A little experimentation couldn't hurt.
That's disgusting. Keep it to yourself.

You're not sure what your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] is up to, but in the last days there have been some strange rumours running in the court, with people asking you strange questions about unclean business.
Tell me more.
I... have nothing to say on those matters.

Your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] caught you completely off guard in the night, hiding inside your chambers and springing out when you were about to sleep. You can barely think of what [From.GetSheHe] tried to do, it was so obscene.
I'll do anything, just stop!
Wh-?! Get out!
Your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] seems to be responsive to your flattery and, even better, [From.GetSheHe] has shown to accept there might be room for improvement on [From.GetHerHis] looks.
Your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] did not care much for flattery, keeping a humble and detached demeanour and giving no importance to the suggestions to improve [From.GetHerHis] looks.
You're just too plain.
You're just too thin.
You're just too fat.

Your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] seems to be finally aware of [From.GetHerHis] terrible state, thanks to your sharp comments and allusions made within [From.GetHerHis] earshot. More to the point, [From.GetSheHe] seems to be open to attempt some improvement.
Your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] stubbornly refuses to listen to your precious suggestions about [From.GetHerHis] looks, regardless of how shameful you depict [From.GetHerHis] situation as.
You're just too plain.
You're just too thin.
You're just too fat.
Your scolding did good to [From.GetFirstName], [From.GetSheHe] finally understands how pitiful [From.GetHerHis] state is and seems eager to improve it.
